com.att.aro.commonui

Class RoundedBorder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.att.aro.commonui.RoundedBorder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.swing.border.Border

    public class RoundedBorder
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.swing.border.Border
    Represents a rounded border for button or panel objects.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RoundedBorder()
      Initializes a new instance of the RoundedBorder class using the default radius for the rounded corners.
      RoundedBorder(java.awt.Insets insets, java.awt.Color fillColor)
      Initializes a new instance of the RoundedBorder class using the specified radius for the rounded corners, and the specified fill color.

             java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Initializes a new instance of the RoundedBorder class using the specified radius for the rounded corners, and the specified fill color.
        Parameters:
        insets - The radius for the rounded corners.
        fillColor - The fill color for the border.

    • Method Detail

      • getBorderInsets

        public java.awt.Insets getBorderInsets(java.awt.Component c)
        Returns the insets (the corner radius values) of the specified border object.
        Specified by:
        getBorderInsets in interface javax.swing.border.Border
        Parameters:
        c - A Component object, that is the border to return the inset values for.
        Returns:
        An java.awt.Insets object that contains the corner radius values.

      • isBorderOpaque

        public boolean isBorderOpaque()
        RReturns a boolean value that indicates whether or not the border is opaque. If the border is opaque, it is responsible for filling its own background when painting.
        Specified by:
        isBorderOpaque in interface javax.swing.border.Border
        Returns:
        A boolean value that is true if the border is opaque and false if it is not.

      • paintBorder

        public void paintBorder(java.awt.Component c,
               java.awt.Graphics g,
               int x,
               int y,
               int width,
               int height)
        Paints the border of the specified component using the specified position and size.
        Specified by:
        paintBorder in interface javax.swing.border.Border
        Parameters:
        c - The component for which the border is being painted.
        g - The graphics object to use for painting.
        x - The x position of the painted border.
        y - The y position of the painted border.
        width - The width of the painted border.
        height - The height of the painted border.
